title: Let $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee} \colon f.d.Vec_{k} \to f.d.Vec_{k}$ be the double dual functor from the category of finite-dimensional vector spaces over $k$ to itself. Show that $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee}$ is naturally isomorphic to the identity functor on $f.d.Vec_{k}$. (Without the finite-dimensionality hypothesis, we only get a natural transformation of functors from $\operatorname{id}$ to $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee}$.)
content: Let $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee} \colon f.d.Vec_{k} \to f.d.Vec_{k}$ be the double dual functor from the category of finite-dimensional vector spaces over $k$ to itself. Show that $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee}$ is naturally isomorphic to the identity functor on $f.d.Vec_{k}$. (Without the finite-dimensionality hypothesis, we only get a natural transformation of functors from $\operatorname{id}$ to $(\cdot)^{\vee \vee}$.)
